de.max.SPAddressDB

Class UserInteract

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.max.SPAddressDB.UserInteract

  • public class UserInteract
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to interact with the user.
    Author:
    mk285

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInteract

        public UserInteract()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is used to print the header, get the database and start the mainMenu method.

      • mainMenu

        protected void mainMenu()
        This method is used to print the main menu. The user is able to choose from a main menu entry.

      • browse

        protected void browse(int offset)
        This method is used to print the database into the console. It will start at the offset 'offset' and will print 10 entries.
        Parameters:
        offset - Starts at the offset 'offset'.

      • createEntry

        protected void createEntry()
        This method is used to create a new entry in the database. The user will be asked to enter the first name, last name and optional the email and phone number.

      • modifyEntry

        private void modifyEntry()
        This method is used to modify an existing entry.

      • deleteEntry

        protected void deleteEntry()
        This method is used to delete an existing entry. After browsing through the database the user can enter the ID of the entry that shall be deletd.

      • search

        protected void search()
        This method is used to search through the database. After entering a search query the program will show the entries matching this query.

      • exit

        protected void exit()
        This method is used to close the program after updating the database and closing the scanner.

      • isEmpty

        protected boolean isEmpty()
        This method is used to check weather addresses is empty.
        Returns:
        Returns a error if addresses is empty.

      • getInt

        protected int[] getInt(int rangeMin,
                       int rangeMax)
        This method is used to return the user input as integer.
        Parameters:
        rangeMin - The minimum range of the input.
        rangeMax - The maximum range of the input.
        Returns:
        Returns the user input.

      • getString

        protected java.lang.String getString(boolean optionalField)
        This method is used to return the user input as string.
        Returns:
        Returns the user input as an string.

      • getRange

        protected int[] getRange(java.lang.String in)
        This method is used to parse a string giving an integer range to an integer array.
        Parameters:
        in - The string that shall be parsed.
        Returns:
        Returns the input range sorted as array.
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - Throws exception if the input doesn't match the format expectation.
